AdditionalFields.Value: Advances in Science of Cancer Health Disparities

Description: This Advances in Disparities Session willÂ highlight the work of three dynamic women in science who have generated groundbreaking research findings related to the causal factors across the continuum of cancer disparities of disease incidence, progression and survivorship. Taking a clear approach with mixed methodologies that unravel the distinct impacts of social constructs and biological determinants in the genetic landscape of tumors. From stress due to racial discrimination, to genetic ancestry, we will have a thought-provoking discussion on utilizing multifactorial analyses in racial disparities research, all of which predicated upon inclusion of diverse populations in cancer research.
SearchResultBody: ADR01. Molecular Epidemiology of Stress and Discrimination and Cancer Outcomes
Title: Molecular Epidemiology of Stress and Discrimination and Cancer Outcomes
